com.xatkit.core.server

Class XatkitServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xatkit.core.server.XatkitServer

  • public class XatkitServer
extends Object
    The REST server used to receive external webhooks.

    The XatkitServer provides a simple REST API that accepts POST methods on port 5000. Incoming requests are parsed and sent to the registered WebhookEventProviders, that transform the original request into EventInstances that can be used to trigger actions.

    See Also:
    registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider)

    • Field Detail

      • SERVER_PORT_KEY

        public static String SERVER_PORT_KEY
        The Configuration key to store the server port to use.

      • DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT

        protected static int DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT
        The default port to use.

        The server port can be customized in the constructor's Configuration using the SERVER_PORT_KEY key.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XatkitServer

        public XatkitServer(Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new XatkitServer with the given Configuration.

        The provided Configuration is used to specify the port the server should listen to (see SERVER_PORT_KEY). If the Configuration does not specify a port the default value (5000) is used.

        Note: this method does not start the underlying HttpServer. Use start() to start the HttpServer in a dedicated thread.

        Parameters:
        configuration - the Configuration used to initialize the XatkitServer
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided configuration is null
        See Also:
        start(), stop()

    • Method Detail

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port the server is listening to.
        Returns:
        the port the server is listening to

      • getHttpServer

        protected org.apache.http.impl.bootstrap.HttpServer getHttpServer()
        Returns the underlying HttpServer used to receive requests.

        Note: this method is protected for testing purposes, and should not be called by client code.

        Returns:
        the HttpServer used to receive requests

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Returns true if the XatkitServer is started, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the XatkitServer is started, false otherwise

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the underlying HttpServer.

        This method registered a shutdown hook that is used to close the HttpServer when the application terminates. To manually close the underlying HttpServer see stop().

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the underlying HttpServer.

      • registerRestEndpoint

        public void registerRestEndpoint(String uri,
                                 RestHandler handler)
        Registers the provided handler as a REST endpoint for the provided uri.

        The provided handler will receive the HTTP requests that are sent to the provided uri through the notifyRestHandler(String, List, List, Object, String) method.

        Note: the provided uri must start with a leading /.

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the REST endpoint
        handler - the JsonRestHandler to associate to the REST endpoint
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided uri or handler is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided uri does not start with a leading /

      • isRestEndpoint

        public boolean isRestEndpoint(String uri)
        Returns whether the provided uri is associated to a REST endpoint.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the REST endpoint to check
        Returns:
        true if there is a REST endpoint associated to the provided uri, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided uri is null

      • getRegisteredRestHandler

        @Nullable
public RestHandler getRegisteredRestHandler(String uri)
        Returns the RestHandler associated to the provided uri.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to retrieve the handler for
        Returns:
        the retrieved RestHandler if it exists, null otherwise

      • getRegisteredRestHandlers

        public Collection<RestHandler> getRegisteredRestHandlers()
        Returns a Collection containing the registered RestHandlers.
        Returns:
        a Collection containing the registered RestHandlers

      • clearRegisteredRestHandlers

        public void clearRegisteredRestHandlers()
        Clears the registered RestHandlers.

        This method only removes the uri -> handler bindings, and does not ensure the the RestHandlers have been properly stopped.

      • notifyRestHandler

        public Object notifyRestHandler(String uri,
                                List<org.apache.http.Header> headers,
                                List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                                @Nullable
                                Object content,
                                String contentType)
        Notifies the REST endpoint associated with the provided uri.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the REST endpoint to notify
        headers - the HTTP Headers of the request sent to the endpoint
        params - the HTTP parameters of the request sent to the endpoint
        content - the JsonElement representing the content of the request sent to the endpoint
        Returns:
        the JsonElement returned by the endpoint, or null if the endpoint does not return anything
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided uri, header, or params is null
        XatkitException - if there is no REST endpoint registered for the provided uri
        See Also:
        registerRestEndpoint(String, RestHandler)

      • registerWebhookEventProvider

        public void registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider webhookEventProvider)
        Register a WebhookEventProvider.

        The registered webhookEventProvider's handler will be notified when a new request is received. If the provider's handler supports the request content type (see RestHandler.acceptContentType(String), it will receive the request content that will be used to create the associated EventInstance.

        Parameters:
        webhookEventProvider - the WebhookEventProvider to register
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided webhookEventProvider is null
        See Also:
        notifyRestHandler(String, List, List, Object, String), RestHandler.acceptContentType(String), RestHandler.handleContent(List, List, Object)

      • unregisterWebhookEventProvider

        public void unregisterWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider webhookEventProvider)
        Unregistered a WebhookEventProvider.

        The provided webhookEventProvider will not be notified when new request are received, and cannot be used to create EventInstances.

        Parameters:
        webhookEventProvider - the WebhookEventProvider to unregister
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided webhookEventProvider is null
